Required only for self-hosted instances. Not needed for the cloud version.
\n 1. Log in to your NocoDB Account.\n:
1. Log in to your NocoDB Account.
  2. Click on your profile-pic(bottom-left) and navigate to **Account Settings->Tokens**.
  3. Create new token with any name and copy API Token.
  4. Your Base URL is where your app is hosted.
Creates a new record in the given table.
Deletes a record with the given Record I: Deletes a record with the given Record ID.
Updates an existing record with the give: Updates an existing record with the given Record ID.
Gets a record by the Record ID.
Returns a list of records matching the w: Returns a list of records matching the where condition.
Allows you to specify the fields that yo: Allows you to specify the fields that you wish to include in your API response. By default, all the fields are included in the response.
Enables you to define specific condition: Enables you to define specific conditions for filtering records.See docs [here](https://docs.nocodb.com/0.109.7/developer-resources/rest-apis/#comparison-operators).
Enables you to set a limit on the number: Enables you to set a limit on the number of records you want to retrieve.
Comma separated field names without spac: Comma separated field names without space.Example: **field1,-field2** will sort the records first by 'field1' in ascending order and then by 'field2' in descending order.
